page.title: 05SIR JOHN OFFLEY SCHOOL
page.content: Sir John Offley C.E.(C) Primary School is a co-educational day school administered by the county of Stafford- shire. Children between the ages of 5 and 11 go to the school, and most pupils then transfer to Madeley High School about half a mile away. There are eight classes, each with its own teacher. The school has about 240 pupils. In the infant classes, the children enjoy learning to read, write and start doing maths. They also talk to their teachers and to each other a lot, learning how to speak clearly and with confidence. In the afternoons, they do lots of different activities like painting, modelling in plasticene, doing jigsaws, sewing, etc. The older children in the juniors do science, history, geography and project work. Many children play musical instruments.
